article_title: Obamacare May Be Delayed, But The Excise Tax Isn't

article_metadata.description: The recent decision to postpone the employer mandate to provide affordable health care coverage to full-time employees under Obamacare (the “play or pay rules”) is welcome news to certain mid-sized companies.

og.title: Obamacare May Be Delayed, But The Excise Tax Isn't - How Much Can It Cost Businesses?

article_metadata.keywords: ObamaCare, Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA), Healthcare, Insurance, Tax & Compliance

article_summary:
The excise tax penalty may be triggered by a wide variety of failures under the law.
Alert your clients that the “other” excise tax penalty is already in effect.
See Also:Under Obamacare, an excise tax of $100 per affected individual may apply to an employer that fails to meet certain coverage requirements and other rules.
Unlike the rules for the employer mandate, this lesser-known excise tax penalty applies to all employers, regardless of the number of full-time time employees.
Employers might try to avoid the excise tax by offering one plan complying with all the mandates and another “bare-bones plan” that doesn’t.
